meanings.sent1: The darkness outside was absoluter than anything I had ever experienced.
meanings.sent2: Her joy at winning the race was absoluter than anyone else's.
meanings.sent3: The absoluter silence in the library was suddenly broken by a loud sneeze.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to his work was absoluter than a diamond's hardness.
meanings.sent5: The absoluter truth of her words resonated deeply with everyone present.

meanings.definition: Not limited by restrictions or exceptions.
meanings.sent1: The teacher's patience was absoluter than anyone had anticipated.
meanings.sent2: The freedom of the open road felt absoluter than anything else.
meanings.sent3: His absoluter refusal to eat vegetables made his mom's job harder.
meanings.sent4: The bond between the two friends was absoluter than any contract.
meanings.sent5: The absoluter beauty of the sunset took their breath away.

meanings.definition: Someone who believes in or supports absolute principles.
meanings.sent1: As an absoluter, she never wavered in her convictions.
meanings.sent2: The absoluter stood firm in the face of opposition.
meanings.sent3: The absoluter's dedication to justice was unwavering.
meanings.sent4: He was known as an absoluter, always sticking to his beliefs.
meanings.sent5: The absoluter's influence on the group was undeniable.
